author: Miranda Larbi
title: A breastfeeding cafe is about to open – and they’re looking for staff
text:
(Picture: The Milk Lounge/Instagram) Breastfeeding in public can be pretty daunting for first-time mums.
Not only can it be stressful cajoling a crying baby into settling down in a crowded area, but there have been countless tales of women being shamed for breastfeeding in their cars or being told to leave restaurants if they want to feed their kids.
This Cardiff shop sells chocolate orange and lettuce sandwiches and people are losing it But for parents in Beeston, Nottinghamshire, that difficulty’s about to become a thing of the past.
A new cafe is about to open designed specifically with new parents in mind.
The Milk Lounge will be a place for breastfeeding mums and bottle-feeding parents and their babies to relax.
It’s the brainchild of 23-year-old Charlotte Purdie, who came up with the idea after feeling uncomfortable feeding her own son in coffee shops.
Here's 10 facts you probably don't know about me! 1. I became a mother at 21 to beautiful Bobby 2. I love singing but I'm completely rubbish 3. I'm a step mummy 4. I love to walk, my perfect day would be in the Peak District 5. I got married at 21 to Steve! 6. I have 1 full brother, 1 half brother, 2 half sisters and 1 step brother! 7. I work as a healthcare worker in a secure setting some nights- I can't pull myself away; I just love the job! 8. I have a foundation degree in Criminal Justice and Human Rights 9. When I was at school I wanted to be in the fire service 10. My proudest moment was when The Milk Lounge opened last year #aboutme #businessowner #me 
A post shared by The Milk Lounge (@themilklounge) on Feb 24, 2017 at 11:24am PST 
‘I became a mum in March 2015 and have had my difficulties finding a clean, comfortable space to feed and change my little boy, I’m sure most parents can relate,’ she writes on her website .
And while some might refer to it as a ‘breastfeeding cafe’, it’s so much more.
‘I’ve always described us as an infant feeding cafe because we focus on all aspects of feeding,’ she tells Metro.co.uk.
‘We cater for breast and bottle and we also do baby-led weaning combos with fresh purees.’
This is Charlotte’s second venture, and like her first cafe, this new branch will have a feeding room complete with sockets for expressing mums, a fan, and a CD player with headphones. It’ll also have a sensory room with lava lamps and glowing stars.
#beeston 
A post shared by The Milk Lounge (@themilklounge) on Mar 16, 2017 at 6:58am PDT 
As well as offering a host of vegan, dairy-free and gluten-free goodies for hungry parents, the cafe will also be offering a daily programme of activities including baby massage, baby ballet and mother and baby pilates.
For those struggling with feeding, professional breastfeeding support will also be on offer .
Whether it’s advising on attachment and positioning, or simply offering a listening ear, the cafe will have fully trained breastfeeding peer supporters on hand to help mums out.
And if this sounds up your street and you’re currently looking for a job, Milk Lounge is currently recruiting staff. You can apply by sending a CV and cover letter to milklounge@outlook.com.
JOB VACANCIES AT OUR BEESTON BRANCH FULL TIME, PART TIME, FLEXIBLE, WEEKENDS AND WEEKDAYS AVAILABLE. Interested? Email us your CV and a cover letter to milklounge@outlook.com We will contact people for interviews on Thursday next week. The interviews will take place the following week. Start date is not yet confirmed but looking at the W/C 17th April. You may be required for training days prior to that date. Tasks involved the daily running of a cafe as you would expect, taking bookings, clearing tables, hosting parties, using the till. No previous experience required as we give all training. Thanks! #jobvacancy #jobs #wanted #barista
